channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rosendale Road SE24 at the junction with Norwood Road is “Rosendale Road”, 22nd September
item.description:
Rosendale Road SE24 at the junction with Norwood Road is “Rosendale Road” street name board tagged – plastic vinyl type – side next to 119 / “Westmoreland Lodge” Norwood Road. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rosendale Road, Tulse Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Mattress, 22nd September
item.description:
This mattress has been here for at least two weeks. It has been reported previously (not by me) but is still there. Please could it be removed asap. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Vanbrugh Park, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rosendale Road SE24 at the junction of Norwood Road island, 22nd September
item.description:
Rosendale Road SE24 at the junction of Norwood Road island between vehicle and cycle lane is a island board graffiti tagged – black plastic rear. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rosendale Road, Tulse Hill, London

item.title: Lamp number 3 on danmark road Nw65dx, 22nd September
item.description:
The light doesn't work and ut has been a month now, as its at the end of street and has become a dark spot, it attracts thieves at night

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Canterbury Terrace, London

item.title: Illegal flags, 22nd September
item.description:
I made a complaint a few weeks ago about the illegal flags hanging in nearly all light posts around the area. You’ve updated the complaint as fixed, which it isn’t. The flags are meant to intimidate and cause racial tensions, and you need to take them down. It is unacceptable that you haven’t done so yet, to be honest. We don’t want them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blacksmiths Lane, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Couple with aggressive and noisy dogs in playground every night, 22nd September
item.description:
Couple who are not resident to the estate let their aggressive and noisy dogs bark for hours constantly every night while sitting and openly drinking alcohol in the playground. They do this every night from 8pm onwards, often until as late as 11pm
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pownall Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped trailer, 22nd September
item.description:

item.title: States the problem has been fixed when it clearly hasn’t., 22nd September
item.description:
Southwark Council continues to practice dishonesty. This issue was reported on 21/09/25 and it states the fly tipping has been fixed , clearly it has not . Please attend to this issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
